meta.description: Learn to organize travel plans professionally using Itineraries and express sentiments creatively through custom Greeting Cards in MS Word.

questions.question: What is a 'Travel Itinerary'?
options: A detailed plan or schedule of a journey, including dates, times, and places
questions.explanation: A travel itinerary is a document that records the route and schedule of a journey.

questions.question: Which tool in MS Word is most effective for organizing a day-by-day travel schedule so everything aligns perfectly?
questions.explanation: Tables consist of rows and columns, making them the ideal tool for aligning dates, times, and activities structurally.

questions.question: What is the primary purpose of a Greeting Card?
options: To express sentiments like congratulations, thanks, or sympathy to others
questions.explanation: Greeting cards are used to convey personal messages and emotions for special occasions.

questions.question: Which type of paper is best suited for printing a high-quality Greeting Card?
questions.explanation: Cardstock is thicker and more durable than standard paper, giving the greeting card a professional feel.

questions.question: In a travel itinerary, why is it important to include 'Emergency Contact Information'?
options: To ensure safety and quick communication in case of unforeseen issues
To make the font look better
questions.explanation: Safety is paramount; having emergency numbers readily available is a critical part of travel planning.

questions.question: You are designing a folded greeting card on a single A4 sheet. Which Page Setup feature helps you divide the page into two equal halves?
questions.explanation: Using the Columns feature (set to Two) splits the text area, which helps in designing the left and right sides of a folded card.

questions.question: How can AI tools assist in creating a Travel Itinerary?
options: By suggesting optimal routes, places to visit, and daily schedules based on your preferences
questions.explanation: AI travel planners can analyze vast amounts of data to suggest personalized schedules and efficient routes.

questions.question: Which tab in MS Word allows you to insert a picture of a destination into your itinerary?
questions.explanation: The Insert tab contains the 'Pictures' command to add images from your device or online sources.

questions.question: To make the front text of a greeting card stand out, you might use 'WordArt'. What does WordArt do?
options: Applies decorative effects like shadows, outlines, and gradients to text
questions.explanation: WordArt transforms standard text into a graphic object with special artistic effects.

questions.question: What is a common element found in a Travel Itinerary?
questions.explanation: Flight details, accommodation addresses, and activity timings are essential elements of an itinerary.

questions.question: If you are printing a greeting card at home, which print setting allows you to print on both sides of the paper?
questions.explanation: Duplex printing (Print on Both Sides) is necessary for folded cards so content appears on the inside and outside.

questions.question: Which formatting feature allows you to put a line or box around the specific paragraph of your itinerary?
questions.explanation: The Borders and Shading tool allows you to apply visible lines around text, paragraphs, or tables.

questions.question: When inserting an image for a greeting card, why might you need to use 'Crop'?
options: To remove unwanted outer areas of the image
questions.explanation: Cropping allows you to trim the edges of an image to focus on the main subject or fit a specific shape.

questions.question: What is the standard fold for a simple greeting card created from a Letter/A4 sheet?
questions.explanation: A Bi-fold (Half-fold) is the most common and simplest format for DIY greeting cards.

questions.question: How can you ensure the text inside a Text Box is perfectly in the middle?
options: Use 'Align Text > Middle' and 'Center Align' options
Use a ruler on the screen
questions.explanation: Text Boxes allow both vertical alignment (Top, Middle, Bottom) and horizontal alignment (Left, Center, Right).

questions.question: Which of these is NOT usually part of a travel itinerary?
questions.explanation: Personal nicknames are irrelevant to the logistics of travel planning.

questions.question: To add a festive touch to a holiday itinerary, you want to change the page color to light blue. Where is this option?
questions.explanation: Page Color is a document-wide setting found in the Design tab.

questions.question: [Digital Skill] When planning a trip, what is the benefit of saving your itinerary to the Cloud (OneDrive/Google Drive)?
options: You can access it from your phone even if you lose the printed copy
questions.explanation: Cloud storage ensures you can access your travel documents from any device with an internet connection.

questions.question: If your table in the itinerary spans two pages, which feature repeats the header row (Date, Activity) on the second page?
questions.explanation: The 'Repeat Header Rows' option in Table Layout ensures the top row appears at the start of every new page for readability.

questions.question: For a greeting card, you want an image to be 'inside' a heart shape. What feature should you use?
questions.explanation: The 'Crop to Shape' feature masks the image so it takes on the geometry of the selected shape (like a heart or star).
